body:
### Problem

`undo` sometimes makes extmarks invalid state.
This causes assertion failure like the following.

```
$ build/bin/nvim --clean --headless +'luafile minimal.lua'
0 changes; before #1  0 seconds agonvim: /home/notomo/workspace/neovim/src/nvim/extmark.c:270: _Bool extmark_clear(buf_T *, uint32_t, int, colnr_T, int, colnr_T): Assertion `mark.ns > 0 && mark.id > 0' failed.
zsh: abort (core dumped)  build/bin/nvim --clean --headless +'luafile minimal.lua'
```

üìù from b04286a18

<details>
<summary>Full backtrace</summary>

```

        vimrc_none = true
```

</details>


### Steps to reproduce

minimal.lua
```lua
local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(bufnr, 0, -1, false, { "test" })

local ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace("myplugin")

local id1 = vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(bufnr, ns, 0, 0, {})
local id2 = vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(bufnr, ns, 1, 0, {})
vim.cmd.delete()
vim.api.nvim_buf_clear_namespace(bufnr, ns, 0, -1)
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(bufnr, ns, 0, 0, { id = id1, right_gravity = false })
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(bufnr, ns, 1, 0, { id = id2, right_gravity = false })
vim.cmd.undo()

-- vim.print(vim.api.nvim_buf_get_extmarks(bufnr, -1, 0, -1, { details = true }))
-- output: { { 1, 0, 0, {
--       ns_id = 1,
--       right_gravity = false
--     } }, { 0, 0, 0, {
--       ns_id = 0,
--       right_gravity = false
-- } } }

vim.api.nvim_buf_clear_namespace(bufnr, ns, 0, -1)
```

```
build/bin/nvim --clean +'luafile minimal.lua'
```


### Expected behavior

No aborted.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.10.0-dev-1099+gf5953edba

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A (extmarks)

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 22.04

### Terminal name/version

wezterm 20230726-161042-3aa7da61

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

build from repo

comment_data.body:
We can put a `has:bisected` label on this as well, I was able to reproduce the bisection (#13243 @bfredl).

Note that `RelWithDebInfo` is needed to run the assertion.

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

labels.description: issue has been tracked to a specific commit
labels.name: has:bisected

title: extmarks: Assertion `mark.ns > 0 && mark.id > 0` failed
